FCM590.name: Special Problems in Family Medicine
FCM590.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FCM590.description: Each student works under faculty direction on an experimental, theoretical, or applied problem.
FCM590.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in the colleges of Osteopathic and Human Medicine. Approval of department.

FCM601.name: Clinical Practicum in Family Medicine
FCM601.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FCM601.description: Direct involvement in a family practice emphasizing patient, office, and personnel management.
FCM601.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

FCM602.name: Primary Care Ambulatory Clerkship
FCM602.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FCM602.description: A 24-week ambulatory care continuity experience involving 12 weeks in a multidisciplinary environment (family medicine, pediatrics, and internal medicine), 4 weeks in family medicine and 8 weeks in specialty areas (internal medicine, surgery, pediatrics, and obstetrics and gynecology). Didactic sessions are scheduled concurrently.

FCM603.name: Core Clinical Concepts
FCM603.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FCM603.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

FCM620.name: Core Family Medicine Clerkship
FCM620.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FCM620.description: Clinical exposure in the area of family medicine.
FCM620.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

FCM621.name: Family Medicine Specialty Rotation
FCM621.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FCM621.description: Clinical exposure in osteopathic family medicine subspecialty rotations. Proficiency in motor skills and aptitudes; comprehension of concepts and principles; patient evaluation; diagnosis; management; therapy.
FCM621.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

FCM622.name: Core Family Medicine Sub-Internship
FCM622.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FCM622.description: Clinical exposure in osteopathic family medicine. Proficiency in advanced motor skills and aptitudes; comprehension of concepts and principles; patient evaluation; diagnosis; management; therapy.
FCM622.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

FCM640.name: Principles of Family Medicine I
FCM640.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FCM640.description: Preceptorship experience in family medicine taught by faculty and clinical preceptors at multiple sites through discussion and hands-on experience.
FCM640.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

FCM650.name: Principles of Family Medicine II
FCM650.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FCM650.description: Preceptorship experience in family medicine taught by faculty and clinical preceptors at multiple sites through lecture and hands-on experience. Continuation of FCM 640.
FCM650.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.
